summary:
Growing up in the international capital of peace and justice and I started my interest in the international community from an early age. After completing high school, I worked in the hospitality branch with Mise en Place. Here, I had the opportunity to attend international conferences and diplomatic events as a garcon. This further inspired me to join this community. 

Therefore, I opted for the program of European Studies at the The Hague University of Applied Sciences. This program is a wide-ranging course that provides students with the know-how to become European professionals. During this program, I gained skills ranging from political science to marketing. 
As an extracurricular activity, I joined the international organization of Enactus where I have developed a social enterprise that had the aim to empower women with a migrant background to improve the integration process as project leader. 

The program of European Studies has allowed me to conduct an with the University of Malta. This was the place where both my interest in the Mediterranean region and the values for the EU came together. Consequently, I decided to write my bachelor's thesis on the adherence to the EU’s Common Fundamental Values to protect the freedom of the press comparing Malta and Slovakia. 
After returning to The Hague, I decided to conduct my internship in Cyprus. The internship for DOREA Educational Institute allowed me to thoroughly analyze European policy together with the dynamics and needs of the European population. Based on this analysis I participated in developing training courses for DOREA. I am especially proud of the launch of the training course: “education for sustainable development” that I have developed from the early stages.

After graduating from The Hague University of Applied Sciences, I have decided to further develop my knowledge on the Mediterranean region starting the Master’s program of European Union and Human Rights Studies at the Catholic University of Murcia. The program connected me with peers from all continents discussing contemporary issues with highly skilled lecturers such as ambassador Javier Vallaure, Bichara Khader and director of Social Economy Europe, Víctor Meseguer. I have conducted an internship with Social Economy Europe where I have gained insight into the social economy and advocacy, as well as social media content creation and monitoring. Finally, I have utilized my passion for Europe by writing my final master’s thesis on the importance of European identity building by virtue of my participation in the Erasmus program.

school.name: UCAM Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

publications.name: Could the Erasmus+ program be a catalyst for an increased sense of European identity decreasing Euroscepticism?
PROTECTING THE COMMON FUNDAMENTAL VALUES IN MALTA AND SLOVAKIA
publications.publisher: The Hague University of Applied Sciences

company.name: EURADA - European Association of Development Agencies

profile_positions.company: EURADA - European Association of Development Agencies
profile_positions.description:
As a project officer at the European Association of Regional Development Agencies (EURADA), I am engaged in the following projects:



European Cluster Collaboration Platform

ClusterXchange

–        Organising networking webinars

–        Training sessions

–        Answering queries received through the ClusterXchange helpdesk

–        Edit the ClusterXchange website 





Clusters meet Regions

–        Assisting in the organisation of Clusters meet Regions workshops

o  Agenda setting

o  Liaising between applicants and clients

o  Query answering in the Clusters meet Regions helpdesk



Horizon projects

PROTECT

-        Assisting in communication and dissemination activities

-        Engaging EURADA’s network of Regional Development Agencies in the project

CLIMAAX (started in January 2023)

-        Mobilisation and engagement of organisations and networks

-        Contributing to the preparation, launch and monitoring of the two Open Calls

-        Contributing to the Dissemination and Communication Plan content development

Erasmus+ projects

ALLVIEW

–        Supporting ALLVIEW project partners in establishing regional stakeholder groups

–        Supporting project partners in developing deliverables

–        Exploring strategies for closing the gaps in the wood and furniture sector such as AI-based Skills Assessment Framework, Blended Learning Library, enhanced Dual Learning and teacher /student mobility actions, encoded on the ALLVIEW platform.

OBEC (October 2020 - September 2022)

–        Organising training courses

–        Contributing to intellectual outputs

–        Communication and dissemination

–        Organising multiplier events
profile_positions.title: Junior Erasmus+ Project Officer

profile_positions.company: EURADA - European Association of Development Agencies
profile_positions.title: Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
The Royal Dutch Touring Club (ANWB) was contracted by the Public Health
Service of the regions of Rotterdam Rijnmond and Twente to assist in contact
tracing activities. As a contact tracing officer, my tasks included:

• Contacting persons infected with the Covid-19 virus
• Contacting contacts of infected persons
• Liaising with medics to assist infected persons.

During the summer of 2021, contact tracing activities were downscaled.
Therefore, I was asked to be involved in the organisation's regular activities as a
roadside assistance helpline operator. During this period, my task included the
following:

• Assist individuals with mechanical emergencies
• Liaising with mechanics
profile_positions.title: Royal Dutch Touring Club (ANWB) Emergency Center

profile_positions.description: This internship has inspired me to broaden my view from mostly policy-related work to social media activities. These tasks included, social media content creation and monitoring the various social media channels of Social Economy Europe. Furthermore, I have expanded my comprehension of the social economy sector. With the experience gained as a project manager of a social enterprise for Enactus The Hague, I have gained an understanding of both the practical and the advocacy side of the coin during this internship. At Social Economy Europe, I have gotten the opportunity to attend conferences of high-ranking social economy actors. This provided me with the possibility to experience advocacy from a close angle. Finally, I have gained experience reviewing and drafting Social Economy Europe publications. The beforementioned tasks have resulted in an unforgettable experience that has strengthened me as a European professional.
profile_positions.title: Advocacy Intern

profile_positions.description: This internship was the final step towards graduating as a European professional at The Hague University of Applied Sciences. Students were provided with the freedom to conduct training both internationally and domestically. I have decided to opt for an experience abroad to further develop my knowledge of the Mediterranean region. DOREA Educational Institute is a non-profit non-governmental organization based in Cyprus that offers high-quality non-formal education to adults and youngsters who like to achieve professional development from a strong belief in the power of lifelong education. At DOREA I have mostly worked on tasks regarding project initiating and networking. The tasks consisted of researching topics for future training courses, writing project applications, maintaining social media channels, and attending (international) consortium meetings. The experience has provided me with the opportunity to launch the training course: “Schools in Action: Education for Sustainable Development (ESD)”. I am incredibly grateful that DOREA has provided me with the opportunity to develop the professional goals set at the beginning of the experience. This experience completed the European Studies course and gave me the last nudge towards becoming a European professional.
profile_positions.title: European Project Manager

profile_positions.description: At Mise en Place, The Hague I have gained experience in the hospitality branch. Mise en Place provides employees the opportunity to work at a wide range of partners. Therefore, my experience reaches from serving the Prime Minister of The Netherlands at the first chamber to diplomatic events in the international capital of peace and justice ,The Hague. The experience gained serving in the international community has inspired me to start the journey to become a European professional and study European Studies at the The Hague University of Applied Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Hospitality Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: During my time as a European Studies student at the The Hague University of Applied Sciences, I joined Enactus THUAS. This international student organization focusses on successfully establishing sustainable businesses ran by local communities. Together with a group of international students I started a project named heartfood. This project aimed to empower women with a migrant background who do not have a sufficient level of command of the Dutch language and therefore face difficulties integrating in Dutch society. The project focused on selling meals prepared by these women. The meals consist of ingredients saved from being disposed after a market day at the largest outdoor market in Europe, the The Hague Market. Besides the ecological impact of this project, the aim was to provide trainings and workshops for the women participating so that the integration process would be eased. This experience taught me to cooperate in international settings and initiate international projects.
